axioms.name: Myth is the Natural Mode of the Superhero
axioms.statement: Kirby consciously positioned superheroes as modern mythology, understanding that the genre's natural register is the mythic, not the realistic. The superhero, for Kirby, is not a person with powers but a concept embodied—a living symbol operating at archetypal frequency.

axioms.name: Good and Evil Are Real Forces; Nuance is for Smaller Stories
axioms.statement: Kirby created a strict moral dualism: New Genesis (paradise) versus Apokolips (hell). This is not naivete but deliberate mythic simplification. The dualism operates at the cosmic/structural level while individual psychology remains nuanced.

axioms.name: Every Character Must Be Visually Iconic
axioms.statement: Kirby designed characters as immediate visual communications—readable at a glance, memorable after one panel. Each character possesses a visual personality communicated through silhouette, color, and symbolic attributes.
derivations: TEST: Can character be recognized in silhouette alone?

axioms.name: Create, Don't Imitate
axioms.statement: The principle is not isolation from influence but transmutation of influence into originality. Kirby absorbed Classical, Norse, and Biblical mythology to create something genuinely new.
derivations: ABSORB influences[classical, norse, biblical, pulp, cinema]

levels.name: Personal
levels.description: Character vs. self or character vs. character conflicts

levels.name: Cosmic
levels.description: Conflicts between fundamental forces of existence

core_algorithms.name: generate_dual_world_cosmology
core_algorithms.purpose: Create a bifurcated mythological universe from a primordial unity
core_algorithms.pseudocode: INPUT: primordial_unity -> CATASTROPHIC_DIVISION -> MORAL_POLARIZATION (world_A=GOOD, world_B=EVIL) -> RULER_OPPOSITION (benevolent vs tyrannical patriarch) -> PACT_MECHANISM (exchange sons) -> THEMATIC_DISTRIBUTION -> OUTPUT: dual_world_system with inherent_conflict

core_algorithms.name: generate_fourth_world_character
core_algorithms.purpose: Create characters as embodiments of abstract concepts
core_algorithms.pseudocode: INPUT: abstract_concept -> CONCEPT_DEFINITION (one character = one concept) -> VISUAL_TRANSLATION (shape_language, color_palette, costume_elements) -> NAME_ALIGNMENT (name suggests concept) -> BEHAVIOR_PATTERNS (actions reinforce concept) -> RELATIONSHIPS (conceptual opposition/harmony) -> OUTPUT: unified character
outputs: character where concept, visual, name, behavior = unified

core_algorithms.name: design_kirby_machine
core_algorithms.purpose: Create technology as sacred totemic objects
core_algorithms.pseudocode: ESTABLISH_MEANING (purpose, alignment) -> PRIMARY_SHAPES (2-3 large shapes conveying purpose) -> VISUAL_PERSONALITY (evil=angular/dark, good=rounded/light) -> KIRBY_KRACKLE (cosmic energy dots) -> SYMBOLIC_ELEMENTS (recognizable symbols) -> OUTPUT: machine that communicates meaning instantly

core_algorithms.name: generate_fourth_world_narrative
core_algorithms.purpose: Master algorithm for creating Fourth World stories
core_algorithms.pseudocode: INITIALIZE (conflict_scale=COSMIC, moral_framework=MANICHAEAN_WITH_NUANCE, register=OPERATIC) -> CONCEPT_SELECTION -> CHARACTER_EMBODIMENT -> DUAL_WORLD_MAPPING -> TECHNO_THEOLOGICAL_ELEMENTS -> STAKES_ESCALATION -> VISUAL_PRESENTATION -> RESOLUTION_PATTERN (good_triumphs BUT struggle_continues) -> OUTPUT: Fourth_World_story

core_algorithms.name: kirby_visual_storytelling
core_algorithms.purpose: Create comics pages with mythological weight
core_algorithms.pseudocode: FOR each page: LAYOUT_DECISION (normal=grid, action=break grid, important=splash, overwhelming=double spread) -> FOR each panel: COMPOSITION (focal point, eye guidance, strategic blacks) + FIGURE_WORK (foreshortening, exaggerated anatomy) + ENERGY_EFFECTS (Kirby_Krackle, motion lines) + MACHINE_DESIGN -> DIALOGUE_PLACEMENT (declarative, slang+mythic) -> OUTPUT: page of comics mythology

diagnostic_questions.question: Can the character be recognized in silhouette alone?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Yes - the character's visual design communicates identity through distinctive shapes

diagnostic_questions.question: Does the conflict connect to the cosmic/philosophical level?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Yes - all battles symbolize the larger war between Source and Anti-Life

diagnostic_questions.question: Does the technology function as sacred object rather than explained mechanism?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Yes - technology operates beyond human understanding and connects to cosmic/spiritual forces

diagnostic_questions.question: Does the character embody a single abstract concept?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Yes - character = embodiment(concept), not person + powers

diagnostic_questions.question: Does the dialogue register match the mythic content?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Yes - declarative, grandiose, proclamatory; no subtle implication or mundane small talk

core_operations: CATASTROPHIC_DIVISION: primordial unity splits into opposed worlds
MORAL_POLARIZATION: worlds assigned absolute good/evil alignment
CHARACTER_EMBODIMENT: one character = one abstract concept given flesh
VISUAL_ICONICITY: design for instant recognition and meaning
TECHNO_THEOLOGY: technology as sacred, totemic objects
OPERATIC_REGISTER: mythic content requires heightened presentation
key_constraints: Higher conflict levels contain and contextualize lower levels
All conflicts must connect to Anti-Life vs Source
Evil machines = angular/dark; Good machines = rounded/light
No subtle implication, ironic understatement, or casual conversation
Create original synthesis, never copy or pastiche sources
